725110f-a.title: Queens: 21st Avenue - 27th Street
725110f-a.text:
21st Avenue, at 27th Street (vantage point). The view is
northwestward toward Berrians Neck, where the Astoria Light,
Heat and Power Company's plants and gas tanks are located. This
property was at one time part of the George Woolsey estate and
the area known as Casina or Lawrence Point (See ''Annals of New-
town5--1852).
P. L. Sperr  March 23, 1932
NO REPRODUCTIONS

725111f-a.title: Queens: 21st Avenue - 27th Street
725111f-a.text:
21st Avenue, south side, west from 27th Street. The grounds
and buildings behind the fence are the Seacrest Sanitarium, known
in 1909 as the River Crest Sanitarium.
P. L. Sperr  March 23, 1932
NO REPRODUCTI1S
